page.title: 14MYTTON & FITZ AREA
page.content: {MYTTON & FITZ { { }The hamlets of Mytton & Fitz are situated in a rural Salopian area just outside Bicton Heath.They are both ancient settlements mentioned in THE Domesday Book of 1085.The name Fitz is Irish & means "some of".The name maybe a corruption ,since it also occurs as Fettis or Fettys in early documents.Fitz & Mytton are both very close communities,having populations of about 30 & 17. Neither have any permanant shops but a library service visits the settlements every week.The River Severn covers a great deal of the area,as well as mixed woodland.
